title: Panel Discussion: Art and Activism
hero_caption: <p>Barbara Jones-Hogu. <em>Unite (AfriCOBRA)</em>, 1971. Gift of Judy and Patrick Diamond.</p>
description:
Rebecca Zorach, professor in art and art history at Northwestern University, Trish Kelly, associate professor of critical and cultural studies at Emily Carr University of Art and Design, and Chicago artist, curator, and community facilitator Faheem Majeed discuss the intersection of art and activism in the 60s and 70s with a focus on print media, ephemera, and protest art.

Presented with the Terra Foundation for American Art

*Museum admission is free for Illinois residents every Thursday, 5:00–8:00—including during this event.
